name: amphibia
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
amphibians (= animals that live both on land and in water but must produce their eggs in water) as a group: All poisonous amphibia use their toxins as a means of self-defence and not to catch prey. As a member of the class Amphibia, frogs live sometimes on land.
More examplesFewer examplesTypical aquatic vertebrates, including most fishes, amphibia and reptiles, use lateral (side-to-side) undulations for propulsion.The corpuscles of birds, amphibia and fish are flattened, elliptical plates.The naturalist Jan Swammerdam discovered the glands in Amphibia named after him.
